column1: Image in weighting T2 of the MRI size (256, 256, 1), showing the head of a man of 37 years old of coronal section. Slice n°46 is observed from the back of the skull. We see clearly: the white matter of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 2966.3086 mm³, the cortex of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 3766.5527 mm³, the left lateral ventricle of volume 168.7500 mm³, the white matter of left hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 329.5898 mm³, the left cerebellar cortex of volume 1622.9004 mm³, the left thalamus of volume 135.7910 mm³, the fourth ventricle of volume 208.3008 mm³, the brainstem of volume 826.6113 mm³, the left hippocampus of volume 104.1504 mm³, the white matter of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 2740.8691 mm³, the cortex of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 3873.3398 mm³, the right lateral ventricle of volume 230.7129 mm³, the white matter of right hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 373.0957 mm³, the right cerebellar cortex of volume 1555.6641 mm³ and the right hippocampus of volume 234.6680 mm³.
